3Vt9tFjjJmSsJ99w.description: 10 minutes of wind-up, 1 hour of operational time, DC 16, standby
3Vt9tFjjJmSsJ99w.name: Wind-Up

UZrxxtljdLoLewB9.description: The pilot engages a lever that activates the clockwork components to transform the adaptable paddleboat's waterwheels into wheels for rolling along the ground. This grants the adaptable paddleboat Speed 20 feet and reduces its swim Speed to 5 feet. This transformation lasts until the pilot disengages the wheels by using this activity again.
UZrxxtljdLoLewB9.name: Deploy Wheels

EKI3Klo7ag2vzNLi.description: Air cycles can be carried into battle beneath a larger airship and dropped from higher altitudes.
EKI3Klo7ag2vzNLi.name: Aerial Launch

cqnHmqahIXXnm7S2.description: 10 minutes of wind-up, 1 hour of operational time, [[/act disable-device dc=19]]{DC 19}, standby.
cqnHmqahIXXnm7S2.name: Wind-Up

zGMODH6r1X3ZbwB1.description: This vehicle must move twice its length for each 90-degree turn it makes.
zGMODH6r1X3ZbwB1.name: Sluggish

DoCusD26UNQbmFNI.description: This vehicle travels on a continuous band of heavy treads driven by a series of gears and wheels, enabling it to travel over rugged land with ease. Earth, rock, rubble, slopes, and underbrush are not difficult terrain to an ambling surveyor. The ambling surveyor ignores difficult terrain from earth, rock, rubble, slopes, and underbrush, and greater difficult terrain caused by those features is normal difficult terrain to the ambling surveyor.
DoCusD26UNQbmFNI.name: Continous Track

R4Co971n6x5ZNJHd.description: 10 minutes of wind-up, 1 hour of operational time, DC 32, standby
R4Co971n6x5ZNJHd.name: Wind-Up

Yr2rxvC8Hzmb70KZ.description: This vehicle must move twice its length for each 90-degree turn it makes.
Yr2rxvC8Hzmb70KZ.name: Sluggish

eXdF4IskaccqgTpS.description:
Requirements The ambling surveyor is not in motion

Effect The pilot and crew release a collection of six clockwork birds, which spend two hours flying over the surrounding area within a 1-mile radius around the ambling surveyor. Everything the birds see is magically transmitted back to the ambling surveyor's crew as illusory images, which the crew must catalogue in real-time if they want to use the information to fully survey the area and create a map. After two hours, the birds return. The birds use the base statistics of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core-2.Actor.9Uc7T3x3cxNo7lvY]{Clockwork Spy} if they are attacked, or if their Perception is important to determine what they can see, although they only perform the Survey action and they don't have any of the other abilities of a clockwork spy. Replacement birds cost 250 gp each.
eXdF4IskaccqgTpS.name: Survey

KFSpJiu6uoHoZl1b.description: A crew member operates a lever set up like a joystick, allowing that crew member to extend and manipulate the apparatus's hands. While the hands can't attack and can't perform fine actions such as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.cYdz2grcOcRt4jk6]{Disable a Device}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.RDXXE7wMrSPCLv5k]{Steal} something, or opening the stopper on a potion bottle, but they can grasp and hold up to 50 Bulk.
KFSpJiu6uoHoZl1b.name: Manipulate Hands

jv3XUW2upC7aFRtR.description: A crew member pulls a lever to open the apparatus's eyes, which shine bright light within 20 feet and dim light for the next 20 feet. A crew member can take this action again to close the eyes.
jv3XUW2upC7aFRtR.name: Open Eyes

mTjyYbkFbVeKoGO8.description: The apparatus of the octopus can protect its crew and passengers from water pressure to a maximum depth of 5,000 feet and contains enough air for 12 hours for a pilot alone or 6 hours for a pilot and passenger or crew member.
mTjyYbkFbVeKoGO8.name: Submersible

uoev6dRtG1YFWPrn.description: A crew member pulls a lever to open two portholes, allowing the crew to see outside the apparatus and other creatures to see into it. A crew member can take this action again to close the portholes.
uoev6dRtG1YFWPrn.name: Open Portholes

eMf9xcynjFjF5ma8.description: 10 minutes of wind-up, 1 hour of operational time, DC 20, standby
eMf9xcynjFjF5ma8.name: Wind-Up

oWlyE6XYOLX2gBB6.description: This vehicle has one rear weapon mount that can be equipped with a ranged weapon. At purchase, this weapon mount is empty. Installing or uninstalling a weapon into this mount requires 10 minutes, a successful @Check[crafting|dc:20|name:Attach weapon], as well as an appropriate weapon to install.
oWlyE6XYOLX2gBB6.name: Weapon Mount

ZC34GK9VgjIwe15Y.description: This vehicle must move twice its length for each 90-degree turn it makes.
ZC34GK9VgjIwe15Y.name: Sluggish

huNcuOUPCQnRwzLa.description: 60 feet long, 30 feet wide, 20 feet high
huNcuOUPCQnRwzLa.name: Space

jXZhSyXIoxCZH7mO.description: Protections from the icy landscape are built into the front of this vehicle, providing sanctuary from the cold. The pilot and crew are protected from severe and extreme cold. The pilot also gains resistance 10 to all cold damage.
jXZhSyXIoxCZH7mO.name: Insulated

myNha9udsrz9laBz.description: The armored sleigh ignores difficult terrain caused by ice or snow.
myNha9udsrz9laBz.name: Ice Traverser

TlSnIZDRiC1KWeOU.description: This vehicle must move twice its length for each 90-degree turn it makes.
TlSnIZDRiC1KWeOU.name: Sluggish

L0S2jaWemV8ndKIE.description: Each of the two sidecars can hold 1 passenger or 10 Bulk. The automated cycle's Speed is reduced by 5 feet for each sidecar that contains a passenger or cargo.
L0S2jaWemV8ndKIE.name: Sidecars

lctMsuE0KxKUZgnH.description: 10 minutes of wind-up, 1 hour of operational time, DC 14, standby
lctMsuE0KxKUZgnH.name: Wind-Up

0R49mrYVzoBBqP85.description:
10 minutes of wind-up, 30 minutes of operational time, [[/act disable-device dc=22]]{DC 22}, standby

For a clockwork to act, it must be wound with a unique key by another creature. This takes 1 minute. Once wound, it remains operational for the listed amount of time, usually 24 hours, after which time it becomes unaware of its surroundings and can't act until it's wound again. Some clockworks' abilities require them to spend some of their remaining operational time. They can't spend more than they have and shut down immediately once they have 0 time remaining. If it's unclear when a clockwork was last wound, most clockwork keepers wind all their clockworks at a set time, typically 8 a.m.

A clockwork that lists standby in its wind-up entry can enter standby mode as a 3-action activity. Its operational time doesn't decrease in standby, but it can sense its surroundings (with a -2 penalty to Perception). It can't act, with one exception: when it perceives a creature, it can exit standby as a reaction (rolling initiative if appropriate).

A creature can attempt to Disable a Device to wind a clockwork down (with a DC listed in the wind-up entry). For each success, the clockwork loses 1 hour of operational time. This can be done even if the clockwork is in standby mode.
0R49mrYVzoBBqP85.name: Wind-Up

xvVoNoxMpRCx3uQo.description: By spending 10 minutes repacking, the backpack balloons can be stowed after the pilot has disengaged them.
xvVoNoxMpRCx3uQo.name: Stowable

zUcSWtLmI7zoyoYJ.description:
The pilot engages a lever that activates the clockwork components to launch two large tethered balloons and fill them with lighter-than-air gas. On the outside of the backpack is a small clockwork propeller. This allows the wearer to wind up and pilot the vehicle.

This transformation lasts until the pilot disengages the balloons by using this activity again.
zUcSWtLmI7zoyoYJ.name: Deploy Balloons

7LOtkjkF6S8p6CRA.description: Crew and passengers can breathe while the vehicle is underwater to a depth of 500 feet or less.
7LOtkjkF6S8p6CRA.name: Tether Buoy

Qx3tJuimyRKT7l2W.description: The bathysphere is raised and lowered from a cable at the surface and can move only vertically.
Qx3tJuimyRKT7l2W.name: Cable

upS8Tctv0gf8rQOC.description: The pilot releases the bathysphere's ballast. The bathysphere moves 3 times its Speed toward the surface at the end of the pilot's turn.
upS8Tctv0gf8rQOC.name: Ballast Release

NPYMeT9SpDiUl907.description: A battery tower is usually loaded with black powder siege weapons for heavy assaults, with bombards on the bottom two floors and cannons on the other floors. Their Price is included in that of the battery tower. When building a battery tower, you can choose to replace any of these with other siege weapons of a lower Price. If you want a more expensive siege weapon, you must Craft it separately. Passengers of the battery tower can crew these siege weapons.
NPYMeT9SpDiUl907.name: Weaponry

bgr3l9R7TMpSYb7q.description: A battery tower has five levels. The crew operate at the bottom tier, turning a giant capstan, and up to four passengers can fit on that floor, enough for a full crew for a bombard. The remaining levels carry 50 passengers each. The tiers are specifically meant to be protective, and give those within the battery tower greater cover (or standard cover if the battery tower is broken). A massive ladder runs diagonally through the center of the battery tower, from the front of the top tier to the rear of the bottom tier. The ladder is wide enough for two crew or passengers to climb simultaneously.
bgr3l9R7TMpSYb7q.name: Tiered

gmtQZ9QzVq0CTB1H.description: This vehicle must move twice its length for each 90-degree turn it makes.
gmtQZ9QzVq0CTB1H.name: Sluggish

8aFZ02PVBVeMw4ey.description: This vehicle has four weapon mounts, one on each corner of the gondola. At purchase, these weapon mounts are initially empty. Installing or uninstalling a weapon into a mount requires 3 hours, a successful @Check[crafting|dc:35] check, and an appropriate weapon. Three of these weapon mounts can be equipped with Medium or smaller ranged siege weapons, and the fourth can be equipped with a Large or smaller ranged siege weapon.
8aFZ02PVBVeMw4ey.name: Weapon Mounts

QsEjXH2LvOJNGXCL.description: 100 feet long, 50 feet wide, 50 feet high
QsEjXH2LvOJNGXCL.name: Space

WodipRtBR55xNfOy.description: This vehicle must move twice its length for each 90-degree turn it makes.
WodipRtBR55xNfOy.name: Sluggish

QItYJDojJ9ncPNBt.description: Bunta can be damaged by spells like @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.PHVHBbdHeQRfjLmE]{Spirit Blast} that damage a creature's spirit directly, and such effects ignore Bunta's hardness.
QItYJDojJ9ncPNBt.name: Spirit Ship

cSPwkOlj0iGk1iND.description:
Activate T command, envision, Interact

Requirements You are piloting Bunta

Effect A silver river flows from your heart, traveling forward in a line that flows around obstacles as if it were water. If Bunta travels at least its speed along the river each round for 10 minutes, you arrive at another plane as if you cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.5bTt2CvYHPvaR7QQ]{Interplanar Teleport}. You arrive in a destination you specify, or a random location if you don't have a choice. If Bunta ever does not travel at least its Speed in a round, you can disrupt this activation. If you continue, you have a 1% cumulative chance of ending up in a random extraplanar location for each round that Bunta did not travel at least its Speed, to a maximum of a 60% chance if Bunta didn't travel at least its Speed for the full 10 minutes. As long as you remain on Bunta, you are protected from any harmful effects of the plane's environment.
cSPwkOlj0iGk1iND.name: Activate

rE4lq3Kyp6tvwM6K.description: Bunta can only be permanently destroyed if Old-Mage Jatembe unweaves it, then submerges each reed in the River Styx at the base of Pharasma's Spire.
rE4lq3Kyp6tvwM6K.name: Destruction

tNXnjpVwYxDnck4o.description: You pilot Bunta into a creature's soul, finding and restoring its true nature. Bunta attempts to counteract all magical effects on the creature. Its counteract rank is 20, with a counteract modifier of [[/r 1d20+40 #Counteract]]{+40}.
tNXnjpVwYxDnck4o.name: Secret of Souls

3aMytFuZW7MG9K0E.description: This vehicle must move twice its length for each 90-degree turn it makes.
3aMytFuZW7MG9K0E.name: Sluggish

WBWEDPfUhbkTJuOh.description:
1 hour of wind-up, 6 hours of operational time, [[/act disable-device dc=19]]{DC 19}, standby

For a clockwork to act, it must be wound with a unique key by another creature. This takes 1 minute. Once wound, it remains operational for the listed amount of time, usually 24 hours, after which time it becomes unaware of its surroundings and can't act until it's wound again. Some clockworks' abilities require them to spend some of their remaining operational time. They can't spend more than they have and shut down immediately once they have 0 time remaining. If it's unclear when a clockwork was last wound, most clockwork keepers wind all their clockworks at a set time, typically 8 a.m.

A clockwork that lists standby in its wind-up entry can enter standby mode as a 3-action activity. Its operational time doesn't decrease in standby, but it can sense its surroundings (with a -2 penalty to Perception). It can't act, with one exception: when it perceives a creature, it can exit standby as a reaction (rolling initiative if appropriate).

A creature can attempt to Disable a Device to wind a clockwork down (with a DC listed in the wind-up entry). For each success, the clockwork loses 1 hour of operational time. This can be done even if the clockwork is in standby mode.
WBWEDPfUhbkTJuOh.name: Wind-Up

bXhue1I61hEB7Gmf.description: 10 feet long, 10 feet wide, 8 feet high
bXhue1I61hEB7Gmf.name: Space

L5LOLKdKxPBT5LCB.description: The cauldron provides its pilot with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.other-effects.Item.I9lfZUiCwMiGogVi]{Standard Cover}, although this cover doesn't typically provide any bonus to Stealth checks, as a flying cauldron is both visible and suspicious.
L5LOLKdKxPBT5LCB.name: Iron Rim

YjzXzqLZdUUgbEwv.description: The cavern crawler can burrow through solid stone at a Speed of 15 feet. The pilot can choose to leave a tunnel.
YjzXzqLZdUUgbEwv.name: Tunnel

a8TydEao18VqapWR.description: 100 feet long, 30 feet wide, 30 feet high
a8TydEao18VqapWR.name: Space

mUDFSYDXMbTtoTve.description: Two crew members each perform a 3-action activity on their turn to open the caravan crawler's mouth and eat a Huge or smaller creature adjacent to the vehicle, who must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:40] save. A creature can choose to fail. On a failure, the creature is swallowed by the cavern crawler, moved into the passenger bay, and knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}. This action fails if the passenger bay is full.
mUDFSYDXMbTtoTve.name: Swallow

jUfFzSzu0PIwCSgB.description: Rocks and stones aren't difficult terrain to a cliff crawler, and it can traverse most vertical rock and stone surfaces at up to half its Speed.
jUfFzSzu0PIwCSgB.name: Mountain Traverser

TPj4AFDezXubgaJm.description: While most burrow Speeds only allow a creature or vehicle to move through loose dirt or earth, this vehicle is equipped with an adamantine drill and can burrow through bedrock and stone at a rate of 5 feet per minute.
TPj4AFDezXubgaJm.name: Adamantine Drill

hCwx6Q30DbNVZa88.description: Because it is sluggish, this vehicle must move twice its length for each 90-degree turn it makes.
hCwx6Q30DbNVZa88.name: Sluggish

kQbyDtF75cOAr2Lc.description: 10 minutes of wind-up, 1 hour of operational time, DC 26, standby
kQbyDtF75cOAr2Lc.name: Wind-Up

scXXuno9YNm1GWXK.description: This vehicle's seats are mounted on a weighted platform that pivots as the vehicle moves, automatically adjusting position with gravity. Seated creatures remain upright no matter the position or angle of the vehicle.
scXXuno9YNm1GWXK.name: Pivoting Seats

TMYxeMEQ1ilLoAlJ.description:
(10-minute wind, 10-minute operation, DC 26, standby)

For a clockwork to act, it must be wound with a unique key by another creature. This takes 1 minute. Once wound, it remains operational for the listed amount of time, usually 24 hours, after which time it becomes unaware of its surroundings and can't act until it's wound again. Some clockworks' abilities require them to spend some of their remaining operational time. They can't spend more than they have and shut down immediately once they have 0 time remaining. If it's unclear when a clockwork was last wound, most clockwork keepers wind all their clockworks at a set time, typically 8 a.m.

A clockwork that lists standby in its wind-up entry can enter standby mode as a 3-action activity. Its operational time doesn't decrease in standby, but it can sense its surroundings (with a -2 penalty to Perception). It can't act, with one exception: when it perceives a creature, it can exit standby as a reaction (rolling initiative if appropriate).

A creature can attempt to Disable a Device to wind a clockwork down (with a DC listed in the wind-up entry). For each success, the clockwork loses 1 hour of operational time. This can be done even if the clockwork is in standby mode.
TMYxeMEQ1ilLoAlJ.name: Wind Up

0CcYSQlAiZcoMkF0.description: Two crew members each perform a 3-action activity on their turn to skewer nearby enemies with the clockwork castle's legs. All creatures under or adjacent to the vehicle at the end of the second character's turn take @Damage[7d8[piercing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:35|basic|name:Avoid leg]).
0CcYSQlAiZcoMkF0.name: Skewering Step

3WQ9vWhVa2yyJCcV.description: This vehicle contains a bridge, engineering room, private sleeping quarters for up to 13 creatures, and four additional rooms (typically a dining room, kitchen, lavatory, and meeting room).
3WQ9vWhVa2yyJCcV.name: Luxurious Accommodations

MBdI0c7xv3ufaJM8.description: This vehicle's interior temperature is magically maintained. Creatures inside this vehicle are protected from severe cold, severe heat, extreme cold, and extreme heat.
MBdI0c7xv3ufaJM8.name: Environmental Protections

VqS08x8SzApqcmVy.description: This vehicle has four rooftop weapon mounts; one mount on each corner of the vehicle. At purchase, these weapon mounts are initially empty. Installing or uninstalling a weapon into a weapon mount requires 10 minutes, a successful @Check[crafting|dc:35|name:Attach a weapon], and an appropriate weapon. Three of these weapon mounts can be equipped with ranged weapons, and the fourth can be equipped with a ranged siege weapon of size Large or smaller.
VqS08x8SzApqcmVy.name: Weapon Mounts

dabct2Mb2XcbWKwb.description: This vehicle is mounted on ten spider-like legs that enable it to turn swiftly, turn in place, and even move backward. Each 90-degree turn made in less than a vehicle length costs 5 extra feet of movement; so, for example, it costs 10 feet of movement for the vehicle to turn around and begin moving backward. This vehicle loses these benefits when @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6dNUvdb1dhToNDj3]{Broken}.
dabct2Mb2XcbWKwb.name: Maneuverable

tS9MnEsewMslgzhi.description: 10 minutes of wind-up, 1 hour of operational time, DC 35, standby
tS9MnEsewMslgzhi.name: Wind-Up

gafl9oZCmfSGtfxj.description: This vehicle hops across the terrain as it moves across the ground. The clockwork hopper ignores difficult terrain from earth, rock, rubble, slopes, and underbrush, and greater difficult terrain caused by those features is normal difficult terrain to the clockwork hopper.
gafl9oZCmfSGtfxj.name: Hopper

uP38cyn9BsX8ni0O.description: The pilot engages a spring-driven mechanism that rockets the clockwork hopper into the air, in a grand leap. The vehicle jumps in a straight line in the direction of its current heading without touching the ground, landing in a space of solid ground up to 70 feet forward and up to 30 feet up. Creatures adjacent to the spaces a hopper lands in take @Damage[4d10[bludgeoning]] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:22|basic|name:Avoid clockwork hopper], and are knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} on a critical failure. The clockwork hopper can't use Massive Jump again for 1 minute. Massive Jump stops working if the clockwork hopper is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6dNUvdb1dhToNDj3]{Broken}.
uP38cyn9BsX8ni0O.name: Massive Jump

zEf7XS6RlEjM0VSO.description: 10 minutes of wind-up, 1 hour of operational time, DC 22, standby
zEf7XS6RlEjM0VSO.name: Wind-Up

0pWllu1H0c2ZTJbM.description: This vehicle is designed to transport heavy cargo over long distances. It can hold 400 Bulk of cargo.
0pWllu1H0c2ZTJbM.name: Hauler

38Zgv0sAfLXH2dfB.description: 1 hour of wind-up, 8 hours of operational time, DC 18, standby
38Zgv0sAfLXH2dfB.name: Wind-Up

7OqKezdHChnhLvmc.description: This vehicle must move twice its length for each 90-degree turn it makes.
7OqKezdHChnhLvmc.name: Sluggish

79YskaB7D1bAmIDD.description: The pilot performs a three-action activity on their turn to vent alchemical fire out the sides of this vehicle. This requires three flasks of minor alchemist's fire, which the pilot loads into the vent as part of the activity. The pilot must then attempt a @Check[flat|dc:5]. On a success, creatures adjacent to this vehicle take @Damage[1d8[fire]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:15|basic|name:Avoid Flames]). On a failure, it backfires, dealing @Damage[1d8[fire]] damage to the pilot and any passengers, with no save.
79YskaB7D1bAmIDD.name: Volatile Flamethrower

Gy4AuNFAGBzfjRFq.description: 10 feet. Whenever this vehicle is being piloted, it continually emits a thin haze of smoke and chemicals. Creatures in the aura (including the pilot and passengers) take a -1 circumstance penalty to visual Perception checks.
Gy4AuNFAGBzfjRFq.name: Smog

yKd1wGx6zmlBwk0u.description: When this vehicle takes physical damage the pilot must attempt a @Check[flat|dc:11] (or a @Check[flat|dc:20] when it takes a critical hit). On a failure, the armored hull fractures and the vehicle loses its Hardness and takes a -4 circumstance penalty to AC.
yKd1wGx6zmlBwk0u.name: Fall Apart

WKcmxoJseJKLLsby.description: This vehicle has 2 weapon mounts, with one on each of its hulls. At purchase, these weapon mounts are initially empty. Installing or uninstalling a weapon into a mount requires 1 day, a successful @Check[crafting|dc:31] check, and an appropriate weapon. The weapon mounts can be equipped with Huge or smaller ranged siege weapons.
WKcmxoJseJKLLsby.name: Weapon Mounts

oUF5jQd985RKQxDl.description: 40 feet long, 40 feet wide, 80 feet high
oUF5jQd985RKQxDl.name: Space

xrqdMttCPa8erSAH.description: This vehicle has massive kite-like spinnakers. Deploying and retracting these spinnakers takes two crew members to each perform a 3-action activity on their turn. While the spinnakers are deployed, the weapons installed on the weapon mounts can't fire.
xrqdMttCPa8erSAH.name: Deploy Spinnakers

udUWMy1N6PlT1qTM.description: The combat kite can carry a glider or up to 20 Bulk of materials. The glider or materials can be remotely released by Interacting with the magical tether.
udUWMy1N6PlT1qTM.name: Cargo Release

5um0QCV3dFiwQPyY.description: 80 feet long, 60 feet wide, 30 feet high
5um0QCV3dFiwQPyY.name: Space

B6R2bCS8bj5B0kiv.description:
30 minutes of wind-up, 3 hours of operational time, [[/act disable-device dc=34]]{DC 34}, standby

For a clockwork to act, it must be wound with a unique key by another creature. This takes 1 minute. Once wound, it remains operational for the listed amount of time, usually 24 hours, after which time it becomes unaware of its surroundings and can't act until it's wound again. Some clockworks' abilities require them to spend some of their remaining operational time. They can't spend more than they have and shut down immediately once they have 0 time remaining. If it's unclear when a clockwork was last wound, most clockwork keepers wind all their clockworks at a set time, typically 8 a.m.

A clockwork that lists standby in its wind-up entry can enter standby mode as a 3-action activity. Its operational time doesn't decrease in standby, but it can sense its surroundings (with a -2 penalty to Perception). It can't act, with one exception: when it perceives a creature, it can exit standby as a reaction (rolling initiative if appropriate).

A creature can attempt to Disable a Device to wind a clockwork down (with a DC listed in the wind-up entry). For each success, the clockwork loses 1 hour of operational time. This can be done even if the clockwork is in standby mode.
B6R2bCS8bj5B0kiv.name: Wind-Up

MlFBTJ5DjdpbaXW2.description: This vehicle must move twice its length for each 90-degree turn it makes.
MlFBTJ5DjdpbaXW2.name: Sluggish

miNi90XzTOPt0eem.description: Combat transports have a series of six large clockwork fans built into their flat under body. These fans can be activated when Stopping the vehicle to allow it to hover within 5 feet of the surface so that troops can be quickly deployed via forward and aft ramps, regardless of the nature of the terrain.
miNi90XzTOPt0eem.name: Hover

Uyksp5Oz4BKXVgmF.description: 100 feet long, 30 feet wide, 20 feet high
Uyksp5Oz4BKXVgmF.name: Space

oswX58DR5DSlxdOO.description: This vehicle must move twice its length for each 90-degree turn it makes.
oswX58DR5DSlxdOO.name: Sluggish

RJf32Bczb9zQaFqs.description: This vehicle must move twice its length for each 90-degree turn it makes.
RJf32Bczb9zQaFqs.name: Sluggish

AU5iAjOfKnbaizIn.description: This vehicle must move twice its length for each 90-degree turn it makes.
AU5iAjOfKnbaizIn.name: Sluggish

ChjOaa11CkBJeVJ8.description: Powered by magical lightning, this vehicle sheds bright light within 20 feet, and dim light for a further 20 feet.
ChjOaa11CkBJeVJ8.name: Glow

XLttadhtgYoOq6f1.description: The pilot overcharges the vehicle, causing it to create a brilliant flash of light. All creatures in the bright light from its glow aura must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:19|name:Avoid flash] or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 minute. The firefly's light dims for 10 minutes, reducing its glow to 10 feet of dim light, during which time it can't use flash. Flash stops working if the firefly is broken.
XLttadhtgYoOq6f1.name: Flash

fG2IE4D8GEe8e98D.description: This vehicle is held aloft by rapidly spinning propellers that enable it to hover 1 foot in the air. It is incapable of flying any higher, and when the pilot stops the magic or the vehicle breaks, it descends 1 foot to the ground.
fG2IE4D8GEe8e98D.name: Hover

V0Iw3ZOvbTqoxlvz.description: The firework pgo moves exclusively via @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.d5I6018Mci2SWokk]{Leaping}. For each action spent to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.uS3qDAgOkZ7b8ERL]{Drive}, the pogo Leaps 20 feet horizontally or 10 feet vertically.
V0Iw3ZOvbTqoxlvz.name: Jump Jet

W01aasqmTJL5TpkW.description: When the pilot uses a 3-action activity to recklessly @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.uS3qDAgOkZ7b8ERL]{Drive} the firework pogo, it emits a burst of flames on launch that deals @Damage[3d6[fire]] damage to the pilot, the pogo itself, and each creature in a 10-foot radius (@Check[reflex|dc:19|basic] save).
W01aasqmTJL5TpkW.name: Unstable Launch

fjG9iutGUirWKbtu.description:
10 minutes of wind-up, 1 hour of operational time, [[/act disable-device dc=19]]{DC 19}, standby

For a clockwork to act, it must be wound with a unique key by another creature. This takes 1 minute. Once wound, it remains operational for the listed amount of time, usually 24 hours, after which time it becomes unaware of its surroundings and can't act until it's wound again. Some clockworks' abilities require them to spend some of their remaining operational time. They can't spend more than they have and shut down immediately once they have 0 time remaining. If it's unclear when a clockwork was last wound, most clockwork keepers wind all their clockworks at a set time, typically 8 a.m.

A clockwork that lists standby in its wind-up entry can enter standby mode as a 3-action activity. Its operational time doesn't decrease in standby, but it can sense its surroundings (with a -2 penalty to Perception). It can't act, with one exception: when it perceives a creature, it can exit standby as a reaction (rolling initiative if appropriate).

A creature can attempt to Disable a Device to wind a clockwork down (with a DC listed in the wind-up entry). For each success, the clockwork loses 1 hour of operational time. This can be done even if the clockwork is in standby mode.
fjG9iutGUirWKbtu.name: Wind-Up

Qz9Kx0LrJvHnpBOZ.description: This vehicle has eight weapon mounts, with two on each side of the fortress. At purchase, these weapon mounts are initially empty. Installing or uninstalling a weapon into a mount requires 1 day, a successful @Check[crafting|dc:40] check, and an appropriate weapon. These weapon mounts can be equipped with Huge or smaller ranged siege weapons.
Qz9Kx0LrJvHnpBOZ.name: Weapon Mounts

hHuH4ZhAExxchTxv.description: This vehicle must move twice its length for each 90-degree turn it makes.
hHuH4ZhAExxchTxv.name: Sluggish

oHxWHVUjvrntFRiu.description: 70 feet long, 70 feet wide, 80 feet high
oHxWHVUjvrntFRiu.name: Space

f9kbmNNkDQy8bSg2.description: 60 feet long, 40 feet wide, 40 feet high
f9kbmNNkDQy8bSg2.name: Space

gQ7lxAlWZocn7vCA.description: The pilot engages a lever that activates the clockwork components to launch two massive tethered balloons and fill them with lighter-than-air gas. This grants the flying submersible a fly Speed of 30 but removes its swim Speed. This transformation lasts until the pilot disengages the balloons by performing this action again.
gQ7lxAlWZocn7vCA.name: Deploy Balloons

nr8xxBKjI4FBoqK6.description: This vehicle has two weapon mounts. At purchase, these weapon mounts are initially empty. Installing or uninstalling a weapon into a mount requires 1 day, a successful @Check[crafting|dc:36] check, and an appropriate weapon. The weapon mounts can be equipped with Huge or smaller ranged siege weapons.
nr8xxBKjI4FBoqK6.name: Weapon Mounts

v5Jv0mJcVUEylX0j.description: This vehicle can land on water and then submerge up to a depth of 200 feet.
v5Jv0mJcVUEylX0j.name: Amphibious

tFb8nV3bxHVLeU8Z.description: With a full complement of skilled rowers, a rowed galley can turn swiftly, turn in place, and even row backwards. Each 90-degree turn made in less than a vehicle length costs 5 extra feet of movement. It can row backwards no faster than half its speed, and it can't turn while rowing backwards.
tFb8nV3bxHVLeU8Z.name: Maneuverable

1kgEMCsta3jRjgwD.description: The roof of a geobukseon is difficult terrain and hazardous terrain. A creature that moves on the roof takes @Damage[1d6[piercing]] damage for every square of that area it moves into. Falling @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} on the geobukseon's roof deals @Damage[5d6[piercing]] damage.
1kgEMCsta3jRjgwD.name: Turtleback Spikes

pBSi7pjOr9qNTYAC.description: When the geobukseon Stops, it's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} by the smoke for 1 round or until it next moves. The geobukseon can't use this concealment to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hide} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneak}.
pBSi7pjOr9qNTYAC.name: Smoking Breath

Ix4GHIqSUqHawiG8.description: The only way to launch a glider is to jump off a steep incline with favorable wind conditions. The glider is uncontrolled and falls 60 feet each round until the pilot successfully @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.yh9O9BQjwWrAIiuf]{Takes Control}. If the glider hits the ground before the pilot successfully Takes Control, the pilot and the glider each take falling damage.
Ix4GHIqSUqHawiG8.name: Starting Drop

LUwtad4TFV730JPb.description: This vehicle must move twice its length for each 90-degree turn it makes.
LUwtad4TFV730JPb.name: Sluggish

dxxn3NqH1AvntQbw.description: A helepolis has six levels. The crew operate at the bottom tier, turning a giant capstan. There's room remaining on that tier for up to six passengers (enough for a full heavy ballista siege crew; see Weaponry). Each of the remaining five levels carries up to 60 passengers. The tiers are specifically meant to be protective and give those within the helepolis greater cover (or standard cover if the helepolis is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6dNUvdb1dhToNDj3]{Broken}). A massive ladder runs diagonally through the center of the helepolis, from the front of the top tier to the rear of the bottom tier. The ladder is wide enough for two crew or passengers to climb simultaneously.
dxxn3NqH1AvntQbw.name: Tiered

gs1T9M7KLq7a9JmG.description: The siege tower is loaded to the brim with siege weaponsâ€”typically bristling with heavy ballistas on its first and second tiers and ballistas on its third, fourth, and fifth. The Price of these weapons is included in that of the helepolis. When building a helepolis, you can choose to replace any of these with other siege weapons with a lower Price. If you want a more expensive siege weapon, you must Craft it separately. Because of the helepolis's structure, any siege weapon in it must launch its payload straight ahead. For instance, a ballista or springald could function in a helepolis, but not a catapult or trebuchet. Passengers of the helepolis can crew these siege weapons.
gs1T9M7KLq7a9JmG.name: Weaponry

xB0A9RW1Zi6TC7g0.description: The only way to launch a Hillcross glider is to jump off a steep incline with favorable wind conditions. The glider is uncontrolled and falls 60 feet each round until the pilot successfully @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.yh9O9BQjwWrAIiuf]{Takes Control}. If the glider hits the ground before the pilot Takes Control, the pilot and the glider both take falling damage.
xB0A9RW1Zi6TC7g0.name: Starting Drop

PLw9fb62MWWOHQ3N.description: The hot air balloon lacks steering and relies on favorable wind currents to carry it in the right direction. If the pilot fails to maintain control of the hot air balloon, the balloon drifts whichever way the wind carries it, moving up to four times its Speed each round as determined by the GM.
PLw9fb62MWWOHQ3N.name: Drifter

58hgK2dQGyCZ2AtQ.description: 120 feet long, 40 feet wide, 50 feet high
58hgK2dQGyCZ2AtQ.name: Space

EnrnSkd1bkrMlaQs.description: This vehicle has eight weapon mounts; one each on the bow and stern, and three mounted on each side. At purchase, these weapon mounts are initially empty. Installing or uninstalling a weapon into a mount requires 1 day, a successful @Check[crafting|dc:40] check, and an appropriate weapon. The weapon mounts can be equipped with Huge or smaller ranged siege weapons.
EnrnSkd1bkrMlaQs.name: Weapon Mounts

RUDtXii4Oi89aeZn.description: This vessel can move through sea ice up to 20 feet thick, leaving a path of open water behind it.
RUDtXii4Oi89aeZn.name: Ice Passage

sQgDqTnfS4q9DdgX.description: This vehicle must move twice its length for each 90-degree turn it makes.
sQgDqTnfS4q9DdgX.name: Sluggish

FFhaWaFrk7hnhcum.description: Iceboats have steel blades affixed to their keels and outriggers that enable them to travel over ice at tremendous speed.
FFhaWaFrk7hnhcum.name: Steel Keel

gfqiKy68ytWvW2OV.description: Ice is not difficult terrain for iceboats. However, they're unable to travel over land unless it's completely covered in ice.
gfqiKy68ytWvW2OV.name: Ice Traverser

RArIVjfgQkucB1UI.description: This vehicle must move twice its length for each 90-degree turn it makes.
RArIVjfgQkucB1UI.name: Sluggish

S2YyMZIBF4csYxyg.description: 100 feet long, 60 feet wide, 20 feet high
S2YyMZIBF4csYxyg.name: Space

UGbQZpoFLMeY4Sgo.description: This vehicle has four weapon mounts, two on each side of the vehicle. At purchase, these weapon mounts are initially empty. Installing or uninstalling a weapon into a mount requires 1 day, a successful @Check[crafting|dc:40] check, and an appropriate weapon. The weapon mounts can be equipped with Huge or smaller ranged siege weapons.
UGbQZpoFLMeY4Sgo.name: Weapon Mounts

MRaXvaSDe5OvOwnS.description: With a full complement of skilled rowers, a rowed longship can turn swiftly, turn in place, and even row backwards. Each 90-degree turn made in less than a vehicle length costs 5 extra feet of movement. It can row backwards no faster than half its speed, and it can't turn while rowing backwards.
MRaXvaSDe5OvOwnS.name: Maneuverable

rtaIKM2ljVIGRhna.description: When attempting a Medicine check inside a medical wagon, you gain a +2 item bonus.
rtaIKM2ljVIGRhna.name: Enhanced Medicinal Tools

kCO9msUmChonUP7K.description: 90 feet long, 50 feet wide, 20 feet high
kCO9msUmChonUP7K.name: Space

z7FmMIh7GhEW7VFc.description: This vehicle must move twice its length for each 90-degree turn it makes.
z7FmMIh7GhEW7VFc.name: Sluggish

gJX0Lvluxa32duRR.description: This vehicle has two rooftop weapon mounts. At purchase, these weapon mounts are initially empty. Installing or uninstalling a weapon into a mount requires 1 day, a successful @Check[crafting|dc:36] check, and an appropriate weapon. These weapon mounts can be equipped with Large or smaller ranged siege weapons.
gJX0Lvluxa32duRR.name: Weapon Mounts

hSynFTcsCqIXxVGK.description: Nighthawks can be carried into battle beneath a larger airship and dropped from higher altitudes.
hSynFTcsCqIXxVGK.name: Aerial Launch

rwza6SRk2Qv2kNXK.description: The raft can be carried overland by 2 Medium creatures or 1 Large creature. Those creatures are encumbered.
rwza6SRk2Qv2kNXK.name: Portaged

9UcPAPPrzEhaoWgY.description: The rowboat can be carried overland by 2 Medium creatures or 1 Large creature. Those creatures are encumbered when doing so.
9UcPAPPrzEhaoWgY.name: Portaged

2UISHdYECuDVkedh.description: This vehicle must move twice its length for each 90-degree turn it makes.
2UISHdYECuDVkedh.name: Sluggish

rvLRBCsFQMdUKtar.description: The sand barge can travel over sand, water, and quicksand equally well, but it can't traverse solid ground.
rvLRBCsFQMdUKtar.name: Sand Skimmer

PqsmKTcXOM0aNYo8.description: A sand diver can only @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.H6v1VgowHaKHnVlG]{Burrow} through sand, using the heat and flame from its alchemical core to slowly dig its way through. The alchemical fumes left behind become trapped belowground as it Burrows, temporarily catalyzing fragments of sand into a glass-like byproduct. Creatures that Burrow through a space this vehicle has Burrowed through within the last 24 hours take @Damage[1d12[piercing]] damage from the shards (@Check[fortitude|dc:17|basic|name:Avoid shards]). A creature that continues Burrowing through a stretch of the same space the sand diver recently Burrowed through must continue to attempt this save the first time each round that it Burrows through the shards.
PqsmKTcXOM0aNYo8.name: Shard Trail

rDwfQJPnK5YyRx7v.description: This vehicle must move twice its length for each 90-degree turn it makes.
rDwfQJPnK5YyRx7v.name: Sluggish

3KAdN0CvRHGl0Fap.description: Sand racers were built to aid in long-distance exploration of Akiton's sandy wastelands, and have storage capacity for 14 days of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.L9ZV076913otGtiB]{Rations} for a Medium creature and 14 days of fuel. They also have a small storage compartment in the front designed to store a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.vLGDUFrg4yGzpTQX]{Repair Kit} and replacement parts for the more delicate pieces of machinery
3KAdN0CvRHGl0Fap.name: Exploratory Kit

PCG0t8B7xMicbSIn.description:
Attempt a two-action Piloting check to Drive the sand racer.

Critical Success The sand racer moves up to its Speed and can turn normally. Choose up to two creatures that the sand racer was adjacent to when it began this movement. Both of those creatures take @Damage[6d6[fire]] damage from the sand racer's burning exhaust (@Check[reflex|dc:30|basic]).

Success As critical success, but choose only one creature.

Failure As success, but the creature gains a +4 circumstance bonus to its Reflex save, and the sand racer moves its Speed in a straight line.

Critical Failure You fail to blast any creatures with the burning exhaust. The sand racer moves its Speed in a straight line and becomes uncontrolled.
PCG0t8B7xMicbSIn.name: Burning Exhaust

TbqVUPF2iKI2xCCf.description:
Frequency once per 10 minutes

Effect The pilot triggers an injection of thasteron directly into the sand racer's engine to briefly increase its speed. For 1 round the sand racer's Speed becomes 180 feet, all piloting checks with the sand racer gain the reckless trait, and the pilot gains a +2 circumstance to any Acrobatics or piloting checks made to navigate specific challenges. A speed boost is terribly inefficient, and consumes a day's worth of fuel.
TbqVUPF2iKI2xCCf.name: Speed Boost

V0HecEvj92RlltT5.description: This vehicle must move twice its length for each 90-degree turn it makes.
V0HecEvj92RlltT5.name: Sluggish

O5JvDSJWNWG2VtpR.description:
Frequency once per minute

Effect Two crew members each perform a 2-action activity on their turn to emit an electrical pulse, dealing @Damage[6d6[electricity]] damage to all creatures within @Template[emanation|distance:10]{10 feet} of the shark diver. Crew and passengers of the shark diver are unaffected. Affected creatures must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:28|basic] save.
O5JvDSJWNWG2VtpR.name: Electrify

V86H5yeH71jmelzY.description: The shark diver can travel beneath the surface of the water, carrying an air reservoir suitable to sustain 11 Medium creatures for up to 24 hours. The shark diver can safely reach depths of up to 300 feet. If broken, the shark diver loses air from its reservoir, reducing the stored air by 10 minutes per round. A broken shark diver has its maximum depth reduced by half.
V86H5yeH71jmelzY.name: Submersible

6fORJn25X1MJPxO5.description: This vehicle has two weapon mounts. At purchase, these weapon mounts are initially empty. Installing or uninstalling a weapon into a mount requires 1 day, a successful @Check[crafting|dc:39] check, and an appropriate weapon. The weapon mounts can be equipped with Huge or smaller ranged siege weapons.
6fORJn25X1MJPxO5.name: Weapon Mounts

FqOevYKM14MsZEdA.description: This vehicle must move twice its length for each 90-degree turn it makes.
FqOevYKM14MsZEdA.name: Sluggish

SVIwF7uOfnrPwzRX.description: 60 feet long, 30 feet wide, 20 feet high
SVIwF7uOfnrPwzRX.name: Space

L3l9AMAPPDLj42J5.description: A creature who is within 100 feet of a siege dragon at the start of its turn must succeed a @Check[will|dc:39] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}. Regardless of the result of the saving throw, the creature is then temporarily immune to this effect for 24 hours.
L3l9AMAPPDLj42J5.name: Frightful

t9Ml1GxjmWer9vBI.description: This vehicle has a weapon mount. At purchase, this weapon mount is initially empty. Installing or uninstalling a weapon into the mount requires 3 hours, a successful @Check[crafting|dc:39] check, and an appropriate weapon. The mount can be equipped with a Large or smaller ranged siege weapon.
t9Ml1GxjmWer9vBI.name: Weapon Mounts

jslLtykhA68xleGI.description:
A siege tower has five levels. The bottom level houses the crew, and each higher level carries up to 10 passengers. The tiers are specifically meant to be protective and give those within the siege tower greater cover (or standard cover if the siege tower is broken). Each tier is connected to the one above it by a 7-foot ladder.

The siege tower has a corvus at its highest tier: a vertical bridge that can be lowered to allow creatures to cross gaps. Lowering the corvus takes a total of 3 Interact actions. Moving the siege tower while the corvus is lowered is highly dangerous, especially for anyone on the corvus. When it's open, creatures in the top tier don't have cover from the side with the corvus, and creatures on the lowered corvus don't have cover except from below.
jslLtykhA68xleGI.name: Tiered

uIzebnQMmGWvKMo5.description: This vehicle must move twice its length for each 90-degree turn it makes.
uIzebnQMmGWvKMo5.name: Sluggish

YQhLb8tPUoxCoxuV.description: The skimmer's hydrofoils are deployed by pulling a lever, doubling the vehicle's normal Speed. However, this makes the vehicle less maneuverable, and it must move twice its length for each 90-degree turn it makes while the hydrofoils are deployed. The pilot can take this action again to retract the hydrofoils and return the skimmer to its normal Speed and maneuverability.
YQhLb8tPUoxCoxuV.name: Deploy Hydrofoil

OklAHvVZjuO3XuoC.description: Two crew members each perform a 3-action activity on their turn to launch a massive alchemical concoction from the chariot. The concoction explodes on impact, dealing @Damage[10d6[fire]|options:area-damage] damage to each creature in a @Template[type:burst|distance:15] up to 50 feet away (@Check[reflex|dc:30|basic] save).
OklAHvVZjuO3XuoC.name: Alchemical Launcher

dDX0a93qZCir17NH.description: This vehicle must move twice its length for each 90-degree turn it makes.
dDX0a93qZCir17NH.name: Sluggish

dWNVc3fRpbqaL7OS.description: Ice and snow are not difficult terrain to a sled, but all other terrains are difficult terrain for it.
dWNVc3fRpbqaL7OS.name: Ice Traverser

Buxx8NC3JQzeLsjs.description: This vehicle must move twice its length for each 90-degree turn it makes.
Buxx8NC3JQzeLsjs.name: Sluggish

XvCWEJlIIDSfz2EA.description: Ice and snow are not difficult terrain to a sleigh, but all other terrains are difficult terrain for it.
XvCWEJlIIDSfz2EA.name: Ice Traverser

cFwKXyV5W3o1v3KK.description: This vehicle secretes an alchemical adhesive that allows it to stick to and climb up solid surfaces. Spaces the snail coach moves through become difficult terrain for 1 round. Any creature that ends their turn on the adhesive must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:23|name:Avoid adhesive] or take a â€“10-foot status penalty to its Speeds for 1 round. On a critical failure, the creature is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} for 1 round ([[/act escape dc=23]]).
cFwKXyV5W3o1v3KK.name: Adhesive Secretions

R2SaS8szVUWwiHQr.description: This lightweight vehicle has no additional storage space for cargo.
R2SaS8szVUWwiHQr.name: Streamlined

iU2xj2sIMM3UdezU.description: The pilot releases built up pressure in the speedster's alchemical steam engine in order to temporarily increase its speed. For [[/r 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}, the speedster's Speed becomes 80 feet and all move actions the pilot takes gain the reckless trait. When the pilot takes an action that already would have the reckless trait, the pilot uses the degree of success one worse than the one they rolled on the piloting check. The speedster can't use Speed Boost again for 1 hour, as the pressure requires time to rebuild.
iU2xj2sIMM3UdezU.name: Speed Boost

kr1leAaQlGXDTwn6.description: 10 minutes of wind-up, 2 hours of operational time, DC 28, standby
kr1leAaQlGXDTwn6.name: Wind-Up

kbVUEpQsOKNyw0BS.description: Whenever the steam cart takes collision damage, its engine expels a dense cloud of steam in a @Template[emanation|distance:5]. The steam cart and all creatures in the steam become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}, and creatures outside the steam become concealed to creatures within it. The steam dissipates in 1 round.
kbVUEpQsOKNyw0BS.name: Steam Cloud

Rb4MyOLlodPUZdJX.description: Two crew members each perform a 3-action activity on their turn to produce a gout of flames that erupts at the end of the second character's turn from any corner of any space the steam giant occupies. The flames deal @Damage[6d8[fire]] damage to each creature in a @Template[cone|distance:30] (@Check[reflex|dc:32|basic] save). The flame jet stops working if the steam giant is broken.
Rb4MyOLlodPUZdJX.name: Flame Jet

CW6raLjyLvZAPowB.description: This vehicle must move twice its length for each 90-degree turn it makes.
CW6raLjyLvZAPowB.name: Sluggish

N548sqSbPhIQTCK2.description: 80 feet long, 50 feet wide, 40 feet high
N548sqSbPhIQTCK2.name: Space

SDMHRAgQKmX9GAlS.description:
Frequency once per hour

Effect Two crew members each perform a 3-action activity on their turn to release a massive buildup of steam around the vehicle, dealing @Damage[11d6[fire]|options:area-damage] damage to each creature in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10] (@Check[reflex|dc:35|basic] save). The release mechanism stops working if the vehicle is broken.
SDMHRAgQKmX9GAlS.name: Release Steam

b3OQJLYv4hEX7yhn.description: The strider can bridge a gap as wide as 30 feet by Striding over it.
b3OQJLYv4hEX7yhn.name: Long Reach

QUHIpCfam8YMHy6U.description:
Trigger The titanic stomper is targeted by, or in the area of, an effect that deals electricity damage

Effect The pilot uses their reaction to activate the Stasian coils, which funnels the electricity into the titanic stomper's electrical engine. The next time Bolt Blast is used within the next minute, the damage it deals increases to @Damage[7d12[electricity]] damage.
QUHIpCfam8YMHy6U.name: Electrical Absorption

lTX8qPMdwaThuCnc.description: The ground shakes with every step a titanic stomper takes. Whenever this vehicle moves, creatures on the ground within 20 feet of its movement path must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:32|name:Stay standing]. On a failure, they are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} for 1 round, and on a critical failure, they're knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.
lTX8qPMdwaThuCnc.name: Quaking Step

vDMm6mf0S2i9JMzd.description: Two crew members each perform a three-action activity on their turn to fire a line of lightning at the end of the second character's turn. This line of lightning erupts from the front of the titanic stomper at an angle of the crew members' choice and deals @Damage[5d12[electricity]] damage to each creature in a 120-foot line (@Check[reflex|dc:34|basic|name:Avoid the blast]). The Bolt Blast stops working if the titanic stomper is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6dNUvdb1dhToNDj3]{Broken}.
vDMm6mf0S2i9JMzd.name: Bolt Blast

R5WxR5cldJYz577k.description:
30 minutes of wind-up, 3 hour of operational time, [[/act disable-device dc=16]]{DC 16}, standby

For a clockwork to act, it must be wound with a unique key by another creature. This takes 1 minute. Once wound, it remains operational for the listed amount of time, usually 24 hours, after which time it becomes unaware of its surroundings and can't act until it's wound again. Some clockworks' abilities require them to spend some of their remaining operational time. They can't spend more than they have and shut down immediately once they have 0 time remaining. If it's unclear when a clockwork was last wound, most clockwork keepers wind all their clockworks at a set time, typically 8 a.m.

A clockwork that lists standby in its wind-up entry can enter standby mode as a 3-action activity. Its operational time doesn't decrease in standby, but it can sense its surroundings (with a -2 penalty to Perception). It can't act, with one exception: when it perceives a creature, it can exit standby as a reaction (rolling initiative if appropriate).

A creature can attempt to Disable a Device to wind a clockwork down (with a DC listed in the wind-up entry). For each success, the clockwork loses 1 hour of operational time. This can be done even if the clockwork is in standby mode.
R5WxR5cldJYz577k.name: Wind-Up

cn6AyWvKXJaJVNRq.description: This vehicle can travel just below the surface of the water.
cn6AyWvKXJaJVNRq.name: Submersible

PcXltLxBnG3FD8dH.description: The velocipede can be pulled along the ground on its wheel by a Medium creature. The creature is encumbered.
PcXltLxBnG3FD8dH.name: Portable

QwXzg5zGAZg4h78t.description: Driving the velocipede over difficult terrain increases the DC by an additional 2 and gains the reckless trait.
QwXzg5zGAZg4h78t.name: Fragile

UQr6y2RUCvhlcvZ3.description:
While the swirling rings of the vehicle don't fully cover the pilot, they offer incredible protection, magically maintaining the temperature within and ablating physical attacks. The pilot is protected from severe cold, severe heat, extreme cold, and extreme heat. The pilot also gains resistance 10 to all physical damage (except adamantine).

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.Item.exwQF6E1FWmuxwBc]{Effect: Protective Barrier}
UQr6y2RUCvhlcvZ3.name: Protective Barrier

izZwMB8zgdsWje9o.description: The pilot harnesses power from the magical gemstones hidden among this vehicle's extravagant embellishments to grant the vehicle additional defenses. This vehicle gains resistance 20 to one of the following energy damage types: acid, cold, electricity, fire, force, or sonic. This immunity lasts until Prismatic Defense is next activated.
izZwMB8zgdsWje9o.name: Prismatic Defense

kt9xSEJnhJNdCBEy.description: 40 feet. The gold, gems, and other embellishments that adorn this flying sphere emit a sparkling resplendence capable of enthralling creatures. Each creature that begins its turn within the aura must attempt a @Check[will|dc:36|traits:magic]; on a failure, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for as long as it remains within the aura. A creature that succeeds is temporarily immune for 1 hour. Each time Prismatic Defense is activated, the area of Captivating Wealth is reduced by 10 feet for 1 hour, to a minimum of 0 feet.
kt9xSEJnhJNdCBEy.name: Captivating Wealth

zni42kvDwzT6lzuW.description: 10 minutes of wind-up, 1 hour of operational time, DC 37, standby
zni42kvDwzT6lzuW.name: Wind-Up

BxBXK2Lkg5eJv3OY.description: A war strider can bridge a gap as wide as 30 feet during a move action as long as it has sufficient movement remaining.
BxBXK2Lkg5eJv3OY.name: Long Stride

ZSrYXt6FfwubLqI1.description: This vehicle has two forward-mounted weapon mounts. At purchase, these weapon mounts are initially empty. Installing or uninstalling a weapon into a mount requires 1 day, a successful @Check[crafting|dc:37] check, and an appropriate weapon. The weapon mounts can be equipped with Huge or smaller ranged siege weapons.
ZSrYXt6FfwubLqI1.name: Weapon Mounts

FlEcs2bcRzhehZlg.description: A creature that Strikes a war wagon with a non-reach melee weapon or unarmed attack takes @Damage[3d8[piercing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:24|basic] save).
FlEcs2bcRzhehZlg.name: Countermeasures

NuseCFEwiUEnOekC.description: This vehicle has one weapon mount. At purchase, the weapon mount is initially empty. Installing or uninstalling a weapon into a mount requires 1 day, a successful @Check[crafting|dc:24] check, and an appropriate weapon. This weapon mount can be equipped with a Large or smaller ranged siege weapon.
NuseCFEwiUEnOekC.name: Weapon Mounts
